sidebar.para: Since &kw-hos-phrase-40; RabbitMQ traffic can be encrypted using TLS. To enable it, you will have to add entries for tls-component-endpoints: in your input model files if you have not already done so. This topic explains how.

listitem.para: Edit helion/my_cloud/definition/data/network_groups.yml, adding rabbitmq to the tls-component-endpoints section:

listitem.screen: cd ~/helion git add -A git commit -m "My changed config"

listitem.para: Then run the typical deployment steps:
listitem.screen: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible/ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml -e encrypt="<encryption key>" -e rekey="" ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
